metadata.title: CVE-2019-10149 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Exim versions 4.87 to 4.91 (inclusive). Impropervalidation of recipient address in deliver_message() function in/src/deliver.c may lead to remote command execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10149` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.2
exim4-base - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.2
exim4-config - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.2
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.2
exim4-daemon-light - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.2
eximon4 - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.90.1-1ubuntu1.2').
